ratings.comment: Mohamed comes off very impatient. He is a hard grader and had made this class very hard. It was very hard to understand him most of the time with his thick accent and awful handwriting ... I wouldn't take a class with him again

Okay so he is nice and very large hearted, but i felt that the second half of the class wasnt manageable and he went a little too fast. Also, he is very genuinely invested in the students success in the class.

Professor Elkhouly made this class very difficult. It was very hard to understand him or read his handwriting, which made up most of the lectures. If you do not have a tablet to pre-download his lecture slides and take notes on them coming into this class, it will be very hard to do well. The tests were fair but the final was very hard.

Professor Elkhouly is an amazing professor. He wants his students to succeed and he creates a lot of opportunities for students to do well in the class. Can be a bit hard to understand at times and can come off as impatient but genuinely cares about his students and is a great teacher.

At first Mohamed was a bit difficult to understand. But after 2 weeks I started printing out lecture slides to take notes, and the class got way easier. He has such a big heart and genuinely wants his students to succeed. He offered extra credit for participation and he always made sure the exams were strictly material we had seen before. I <3 HIM

Professor Elkhouly was a decent professor. His lectures are okay, but a bit confusing at times. Highly recommend going to the discussion section. The exams are difficult (especially 2 and 3) and you need to go to class and study. Homework is time-consuming, but he and the TAs respond quickly to emailed questions. Good online transition as well.

I really dreaded this class every week. His lectures really stressed me out because they were so unorganized and extremely hard to follow. He will ask a question and the room goes silent because it seems like no one knows what he is talking about. I depended on discussions to learn the material.

Professor Elkhouly can be difficult to understand, but you get used to his speaking style a couple weeks into the semester. He can be a bit disorganized, but going to lecture is important because exams are only based on his the information in his lectures. He really wants his students to succeed so if you put in the work you can do very well

Lectures aren't technically mandatory, but the lecture slides he posts online are incomplete. You have to attend lecture (or convince someone else to send you their notes) to fill in really random blanks, equations, and sometimes important test topics. Exams aren't too hard, you get a half sheet of paper for equations. Overall, he's okay.

At first, I didn't like Professor Elkhouly, he was hard to understand and I thought he should've explained things more clearly. However he turned out to be a great professor, really wants everyone in the class to succeed and his exams are fair, if you do the work you will get and A. I would recommend him as a stats professor to any student.

At first Elkhouly's beautiful accent is challenging, but with the fill in the blank lecture slides, you come to understand his accent just fine, as well as have a very good collection of notes and examples. He can go fast, but is always open for questions during & outside of class. He is more than fair and kind, but you must practice problems.

I literally never understand what he is saying because his accent is so thick. His lectures are confusing and I don't know where he is pulling numbers out of. He asks questions during lecture and the room goes silent because either nobody knows the answer or nobody knows what he is even asking. Long story short, this class is bogus. Study or fail.

Very nice guy; really cares and tries to make sure everyone understands the material. Takes time to review before exams, which are easy if you take the time to study. Attendance is mandatory as the powerpoint slides are posted with blanks and the discussions are a waste of time depending on your TA
